page.title: 12 RELIGION
page.content: Rev.J.Binns of Christchurch, Sheen, told us there are 7 Christian churches in our part of the Parish - 3 Anglican, 1 RC, 1 Baptist, 1 United Reformed and 1 Plymouth Brethren. There are no non-Christian groups substantial enough to warrant places of worship, though there is a synagogue in Richmond. Christchurch has an average Sunday attendance of 200 - quite good, and slightly up on the 1960s. The Christian clergy meet monthly for discussions and prayer. Churches also cooperate on social projects (cf.{FISH scheme) and the Churches Housing Trust. 18% of the C.of E. Sunday collection goes to charities at home and abroad - 18,000 pounds last year. Members are active in charities, political lobbying, CND etc. Plan to house needy in old Mortlake school.
